title: League of Legends FPS spikes
body:
For some reason, my brand new Dell Laptop FPS spikes during a League match. My FPS is usually at 60, but rnadomly it would spike to 0. 
Processor:Intel(R)Core(TM) i5-5200U CPU @ 2.20GHz 2.20 GHz
Installed memory (RAM) 4.00GB
System type: 64-bit Operating System, x64-based processor
I am using a Windows 8.1 Laptop. If you would like to tell me anything useful, please do so.

replies.body:
>Intel(R)Core(TM) i5-5200U CPU @ 2.20GHz 2.20 GHz

That's not the best start. Sounds more suited for office work, not gaming.

>didn't mention a graphic card.

Considering the graphic's card is what does the most work when it comes to running games, you should probably list that too. Unless you don't have one. Which would mean you have an internal one. If that's the case, then that's the problem. You should go and buy a graphics card.

To see what your computer thinks it installed, run dxdiag.exe and go to the "Display" tab.
